--- title: Iliocostalis --- ::: {#tbl-iliocostalis-muscles-oian .cell message='false' tbl-cap='Iliocostalis muscles' execution_count=1} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Muscle Origin Insertion Innervation Action
``` ::: ::: # Iliocostalis Cervicis ## Origin {#origin} 3rd-7th ribs @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ## Insertion {#insertion} C4-C6 TP @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ## Innervation {#innervation} [Spinal nn.]({{< var ref-spinal-nerves.path >}}) C8-L1 (Post rami, lateral branches) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ## Action {#action} # Iliocostalis Thoracis ## Origin {#origin} 7-12th ribs @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ## Insertion {#insertion} 1st-6th ribs @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ## Innervation {#innervation} [Spinal nn.]({{< var ref-spinal-nerves.path >}}) C8-L1 (Post rami, lateral branches) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ## Action {#action} # Iliocostalis Lumborum ## Origin {#origin} Sacrum, iliac crest, lumbar vertebrae SP; lower thoracic vertebrae TP @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ## Insertion {#insertion} 6-12th ribs, thoracolumbar fascia (posterior layer), upper lumbar vertebrae (TP) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ## Innervation {#innervation} [Spinal nn.]({{< var ref-spinal-nerves.path >}}) C8-L1 (Post rami, lateral branches) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ## Action {#action} - **Bilateral:** Extends spine @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 - **Unilateral:** I/L spine lat-flexion @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Muscle groups Iliocostalis is part of the [Intermediate intrinsic back muscles (erector spinae)]({{< var ref-oians >}}) # Palpation # Clinical significance
